intro: Lesquerella densipila var. maxima, commonly known as the desert lesquerella, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. The plant produces capsules that contain oily seeds, which are rich in erucic acid and have industrial applications. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures.
